title: Payment-link monetization section with navigation, FAQ update, and optional click tracking UI

requirements.summary: Add a responsive landing-page section explaining outbound payment links for Apple Pay (Apple Wallet) and Cash App with prominent CTAs opening in a new tab.
acceptanceCriteria: A new section is visible on the main landing page with a clear heading (English) describing getting paid via Apple Pay/Apple Wallet and Cash App.

The section includes at least two prominent outbound CTAs (one for Apple Pay/Apple Wallet, one for Cash App) implemented as links/buttons that open in a new tab (target="_blank" and rel="noopener noreferrer").
User-facing text clearly states that Boostly does not process payments directly on-site and that payments happen on the linked provider page (English).
The section UI is responsive and matches existing site styling patterns (container spacing, cards/buttons, Tailwind).

file_operations.description: Create a new Payments/Monetization section component with English explanatory copy (no claims of native on-site Apple Wallet/Cash App integration) and two prominent outbound CTAs (Apple Pay/Apple Wallet payment link and Cash App link) that open in a new tab with rel="noopener noreferrer". Use existing styling patterns (container, responsive grid, cards) and use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card, Button, Badge) to match the site. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the new PaymentMonetizationSection into the main landing page flow (in a logical position among existing sections) and create a dedicated ref/scroll target for it so it is reachable via on-page navigation.

requirements.summary: Add a new desktop and mobile navigation item that scrolls to the payments/monetization section using existing scroll behavior/offset.
acceptanceCriteria: The top navigation includes a new item (English label) that scrolls to the payments/monetization section.
The new navigation item works in both the desktop nav and the mobile sheet menu.
Scrolling behavior and scroll offset are consistent with other sections (no content hidden under the fixed navbar).

file_operations.description: Add a new nav item (English label such as "Payments") to the existing desktop buttons and mobile sheet menu; extend the section union/type to include the new payments section key while keeping existing onNavigate pattern intact. Use existing shadcn-ui Button/Sheet patterns already in this file. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Extend the onNavigate section mapping to include the new payments section ref so clicking the new nav item scrolls with the same offset behavior as other sections.

requirements.summary: Add an English FAQ item explaining link-based payments for Apple Pay (Apple Wallet) and Cash App and clarifying that “paid per click” requires external monetization models (affiliate/ads) rather than direct on-page collection.
acceptanceCriteria: A new FAQ item appears in the existing FAQ accordion with an English question/answer covering Apple Pay (Apple Wallet) and Cash App link-based payments.
The FAQ copy explicitly clarifies the difference between (a) getting paid when someone completes a payment and (b) getting paid per click (which typically requires affiliate/ads arrangements).
The FAQ item is indexed by the existing on-page search (since FAQs are already included in the search index).

file_operations.description: Add a new FAQ entry (unique id) with an English question/answer that explains Boostly uses outbound payment links for Apple Pay/Apple Wallet and Cash App, clarifies Boostly does not process payments on-site, and explains that “getting paid per click” generally requires external affiliate/ads arrangements rather than the payment link itself.

Ensure the new FAQ item renders correctly within the existing accordion mapping (no structural changes needed beyond any necessary compatibility updates), and that the item id remains usable as a scroll/highlight target as done for other FAQs. Use existing shadcn-ui Accordion/Badge patterns (without editing ui component files). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement UI support for optional outbound click tracking (record clicks, fetch counts, show counts or a non-blocking unavailable state).
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the Apple Pay CTA increments an Apple Pay click counter; clicking the Cash App CTA increments a Cash App click counter.
Click counts persist across page refreshes (stored in canister stable state).
The payments/monetization section displays the current click counts in a simple, readable way (English labels).
If the backend is unreachable, the UI still allows navigation to the outbound payment links and shows a non-blocking message/state for unavailable counts (English).

file_operations.description: Create a small hook that uses the existing actor (via useActor/useBackendQueries) and React Query to (1) fetch current click counts for the payment CTAs and (2) expose a function to record a click for a given button id. The hook should gracefully handle backend unavailability (return an unavailable state/message without throwing) so outbound navigation remains unaffected.

Integrate optional click tracking into the two outbound CTAs: on click, attempt to record the click via the hook (non-blocking) and render the latest click counts in the section with simple English labels. Ensure that if counts cannot be loaded (backend unreachable), the section still shows working outbound links and a non-blocking English unavailable state. Use existing shadcn-ui components (e.g., Badge, Card, Alert if available) for a consistent UI. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
